snippet: One woman died and several people were injured in a stampede by students desperate to apply for admission to a public university.
abstract: Thousands of students, many accompanied by their anxious parents, surge forward at University of Johannesburg, desperate to win one of several hundred last-chance places still open at South Africa's public universities and, amid shoving and screams, one woman is trampled to death and several others are badly injured in a frantic stampede; incident embodies the broad crisis in country's overstretched higher education system as it struggles to expand opportunities once reserved for whites to all South Africans.
lead_paragraph: One woman died and several people were injured in a stampede by students desperate to apply for admission to a public university.

headline.seo: South African Stampede Highlights Crisis at Universities
headline.main: Fatal Stampede in South Africa Points Up University Crisis
headline.print_headline: Fatal Stampede in South Africa Points Up Crisis at Universities
